intro: Glandularia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian glandularia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant features glandular hairs on its stems and leaves, which secrete oils and contribute to its unique aroma. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
